notes: Use rubber-linings-v2.html as the HTML/CSS template. Replace content per page.
<em> tags render as italic green text in the template.
hero_photo: Unsplash w=1800&h=1200. evidence_strip: w=1800&h=800. gallery: w=1200&h=900 first, w=1000&h=900 rest.
Specs table ratings: rating_a=Excellent(green), rating_b=Good(blue), rating_c=Limited(orange), rating_x=N/A(gray).
Rubber Linings page is the BUILT template reference — NOT included here.
hero_num = position within parent division (01, 02, etc).
Process & Plant Design was previously built but should be rebuilt using this template for consistency.
template_sections: S0: Hero — full viewport, canvas particles, bg photo, breadcrumb, badge, title, lead, 4-stat strip
Sibling Nav — division label + horizontal links, active state on current page
S1: Intro — editorial offset: prose left (overline, h2, paragraphs, pull quote), meta panel right (tag groups)
Evidence Strip — full-bleed photo with overlay text
S2: Materials/Capabilities — overline, h2, description, 2x2 card grid (symbol, title, subtitle, desc, tags, specs)
S3: Gallery — horizontal scroll, 5 slides with desaturated photos and captions
S4: Process Timeline — dark section, vertical numbered steps with spec pills
S5: Specs Table — data table with color-coded ratings
Integration Band — links to related services within Jasmino
S6: Case Study — full-bleed bg, title, description, 3 stat cards
S7: CTA — gradient band with headline + two buttons
Sticky Bar — service name + contact + buttons (fixed bottom)

pages.page_title: Process & Plant Design — Jasmino Engineering Design

hero.lead: Complete plant engineering from feasibility studies through detailed 3D modelling — with fabrication constraints built into every design decision from day one.

intro.title_html: Engineering plants that are designed to be built
paragraphs: Jasmino's engineering team handles complete plant design from feasibility through detailed engineering. We work as EPCM contractors for small and medium-scale industrial plants across chemical, pharmaceutical, fertilizer, water treatment, and power sectors.

What separates our process engineering from a standalone consultancy: every design decision accounts for our own fabrication capabilities. Vessel nozzle orientations, piping routing, equipment spacing — all designed with manufacturing tolerances and lining access requirements in mind.
Our SP3D-based 3D modelling environment means the engineering deliverables go directly to our fabrication floor. No re-interpretation, no translation errors, no lost design intent.

pull_quote.text: Design for manufacturing — not just for approval. Every P&ID we issue can be built on our shop floor.

materials_section.description: Our process engineering scope covers every phase of plant design — each delivered with fabrication awareness.

cards.title: Process Design
cards.subtitle: Feasibility · Simulation · Optimisation
cards.description: Process flow development, mass and energy balance, simulation, and technology selection. We define the process before designing the plant around it.

cards.title: Detailed Engineering
cards.subtitle: P&IDs · Specs · Datasheets
cards.description: Piping and instrumentation diagrams, equipment datasheets, line lists, instrument lists, and control narratives. Every document production-ready.

cards.title: 3D Plant Modelling
cards.subtitle: SP3D · Clash Detection · Walkthrough
cards.description: Full 3D intelligent plant models with automated clash detection, isometric extraction, and virtual walkthroughs for client review before fabrication begins.

cards.title: Safety & Risk Studies
cards.subtitle: HAZOP · HAZID · SIL
cards.description: Hazard and operability studies, hazard identification, SIL classification, and relief valve sizing. Integrated into the design process — not bolted on after.

process_timeline.description: A structured engineering workflow that accounts for fabrication and protection requirements from the earliest phase.

steps.title: Feasibility & Concept
steps.description: Technology selection, preliminary mass balance, block flow diagrams, and project economics.

steps.title: Basic Engineering
steps.description: PFDs, preliminary P&IDs, equipment sizing, plot plan development, and utility requirements.

steps.title: Detailed Engineering
steps.description: Final P&IDs, equipment datasheets, 3D modelling, piping stress analysis, and instrumentation design. Full IFC documentation package.

steps.title: Procurement Support
steps.description: Technical bid evaluation, vendor drawing review, material requisitions. In-house fabrication items go directly to our shop floor.

steps.title: Construction Support
steps.description: Site supervision, installation verification, pre-commissioning procedures, and as-built documentation.

steps.title: Commissioning & Handover
steps.description: Operational testing, performance verification, training, and complete project documentation handover.

specs_table.description: Engineering deliverables mapped to project phases.

case_study.description: Full engineering package from process simulation through 3D modelling and construction support. 14-month delivery, on budget, zero design rework during fabrication.

cta.description: Share your process requirements and we'll scope the engineering.

hero.lead: Pressure vessels, heat exchangers, reactors, columns, and storage tanks — engineered to international codes with fabrication and lining requirements designed in from the start.

intro.title_html: Designed for the code. Designed for the shop floor.
paragraphs: Jasmino's equipment design team engineers pressure vessels, heat exchangers, reactors, columns, and storage tanks to ASME Section VIII, API 650/620, PED, IS 2825, and BS 5500 standards.

Because our designers sit in the same office as our fabricators, every design decision accounts for manufacturing reality — weld access, rolling capacity, head forming limits, and lining geometry requirements.

For equipment requiring rubber or plastic lining, our design engineers coordinate with the corrosion protection team from day one — ensuring nozzle projections, internal access, and surface geometry support flawless lining application.

pull_quote.text: We don't design equipment that someone else has to figure out how to build. We design it — then we build it ourselves.

materials_section.description: Each equipment type follows specific design codes and manufacturing constraints.

cards.title: Pressure Vessels
cards.subtitle: ASME VIII Div 1 & 2
cards.description: Vertical and horizontal vessels, columns, and reactors. Design pressures up to 350 bar, temperatures to 550°C. FEA for complex geometries.

cards.title: Heat Exchangers
cards.subtitle: TEMA · HTRI Rated
cards.description: Shell-and-tube, plate, air-cooled, and jacketed designs. Thermal rating, mechanical design, and vibration analysis under one roof.

cards.title: Storage Tanks
cards.subtitle: API 650 · API 620
cards.description: Atmospheric and low-pressure storage tanks. Fixed roof, floating roof, and cone roof configurations with seismic and wind analysis.

cards.title: Reactors & Columns
cards.subtitle: Custom Internals · Lining-Ready
cards.description: Chemical reactors, distillation columns, absorption towers with internal distribution systems. Designed with lining access geometry.

process_timeline.description: A structured design workflow with built-in manufacturing coordination.

steps.title: Design Basis & Data Review
steps.description: Process datasheet review, material selection, code determination. Design basis document issued for alignment.

steps.title: Mechanical Design Calculations
steps.description: Shell, head, nozzle, flange, and support calculations per applicable code. Wind, seismic, and operational load cases.

steps.title: Thermal Rating
steps.description: HTRI thermal rating for heat exchangers. Optimised for process duty while maintaining mechanical feasibility.

steps.title: General Arrangement Drawings
steps.description: GA drawings with nozzle orientation, internals, supports, and lifting. Reviewed against fabrication and lining constraints.

steps.title: Detail & Shop Drawings
steps.description: Fabrication drawings with weld details, bill of materials, and cutting plans. Issued directly to Jasmino's manufacturing division.

steps.title: Third-Party Approval
steps.description: Submission to TÜV, BV, Lloyd's, or client-nominated TPI. Drawings revised and stamped for production.

specs_table.description: Equipment types and applicable design codes handled in-house.

case_study.description: Four agitated reactors designed, fabricated, and rubber-lined for a phosphoric acid plant. Lining access geometry designed into the vessel from the first GA drawing.

cta.description: Share your process datasheet and we'll provide a design proposal.

hero.badge_text: SP3D + CAESAR II · Full Stress Analysis
hero.lead: 3D piping layout, stress analysis, and isometric extraction — all from the same SP3D model that drives our fabrication. Zero translation between design and shop floor.

paragraphs: Piping design at Jasmino starts in the same 3D model as the process and equipment design — SP3D. Piping routes are designed with full awareness of equipment nozzle locations, structural steel, cable trays, and access requirements.
Our piping stress engineers use CAESAR II for static and dynamic analysis, ensuring every line meets code requirements for thermal expansion, weight, wind, and seismic loading.
Because we fabricate our own pipe spools, the isometrics extracted from our 3D model go directly to our shop floor. Material take-offs are auto-generated — no spreadsheet errors, no manual re-entry.

pull_quote.text: The same model that generates the isometric also generates the shop cutting list. That's integration.

evidence_strip.caption: SP3D Model · Clash-Free · Auto ISO Extraction

materials_section.description: From routing through stress analysis to fabrication support.

cards.title: 3D Piping Layout
cards.subtitle: SP3D · Clash Detection
cards.description: Intelligent 3D piping routing with automatic clash detection against equipment, structural, electrical, and instrumentation models.

cards.title: Stress Analysis
cards.subtitle: CAESAR II · Static & Dynamic
cards.description: Thermal expansion, sustained loads, occasional loads (wind/seismic), and dynamic analysis for vibration-sensitive lines.

cards.title: Isometric Extraction
cards.subtitle: Auto-Generated · Shop-Ready
cards.description: Isometric drawings auto-extracted from the 3D model with complete BOM, weld counts, and fabrication notes. Direct to shop floor.

cards.title: Support Design
cards.subtitle: Spring Hangers · Guides · Anchors
cards.description: Pipe support design coordinated with stress analysis results. Spring selection, guide spacing, and anchor load calculations.

process_timeline.description: Structured piping design workflow with built-in fabrication coordination.

steps.title: Line List & Spec Development
steps.description: Line list from P&IDs, piping class and material specification development, valve and fitting selection.

steps.title: 3D Routing & Layout
steps.description: Pipe routing in SP3D with clash detection against all disciplines. Equipment nozzle connections verified in 3D.

steps.title: Stress Analysis
steps.description: CAESAR II stress analysis for all critical lines. Support locations and types defined from stress output.

steps.title: Isometric & MTO Extraction
steps.description: Auto-extraction of fabrication isometrics and material take-off from the 3D model.

steps.title: Fabrication & Installation Support
steps.description: Shop queries resolved from the 3D model. Site supervision for installation verification.

specs_table.description: Piping design and stress analysis capabilities across applicable codes.

case_study.description: Full 3D piping design for a greenfield phosphoric acid plant. 2,400+ isometrics auto-extracted from SP3D model. Zero rework during construction.

cta.description: Share your P&IDs and we'll scope the piping engineering.

hero.badge_text: ETP · STP · DM · RO · UF · ZLD
hero.lead: Complete water and wastewater treatment plant engineering — from process design through equipment supply. ETP, STP, DM, RO, UF, and zero liquid discharge systems.

paragraphs: Water treatment at Jasmino isn't a standalone business — it's an extension of our process engineering capability. We design and supply complete ETP, STP, DM, RO, UF, and ZLD systems for industrial clients.
The advantage: the treatment equipment — FRP tanks, PP vessels, rubber-lined steel tanks — is all fabricated in-house. No sourcing delays, no third-party quality risks.
We handle everything from treatability studies and process simulation through detailed engineering, equipment supply, and commissioning support. One contract, one point of accountability.

pull_quote.text: The treatment tanks, the FRP vessels, the rubber-lined equipment — we design and manufacture all of it in-house.

materials_section.description: From primary treatment through polishing and zero liquid discharge.

cards.title: Effluent Treatment
cards.subtitle: Industrial Wastewater
cards.description: Complete ETP design for chemical, pharmaceutical, and industrial effluents. Physical, chemical, and biological treatment stages sized for compliance.

cards.title: Membrane Systems
cards.subtitle: RO · UF · NF
cards.description: Reverse osmosis, ultrafiltration, and nanofiltration systems. Process design, membrane selection, and skid fabrication.

cards.title: Demineralisation
cards.subtitle: Ion Exchange · EDI
cards.description: Conventional DM plants with cation, anion, and mixed-bed exchangers. EDI for high-purity applications. In-house FRP/rubber-lined vessels.

cards.title: Zero Liquid Discharge
cards.subtitle: Evaporation · Crystallisation
cards.description: ZLD systems combining membrane concentration, evaporation, and crystallisation. Designed to meet zero effluent discharge requirements.

process_timeline.title_html: From raw effluent data to compliant discharge
process_timeline.description: A structured approach to water treatment project delivery.

steps.title: Treatability Study
steps.description: Effluent characterisation, jar testing, pilot trials where required.

steps.title: Process Design
steps.description: Treatment scheme development, mass balance, equipment sizing, and hydraulic profile.

steps.title: Detailed Engineering
steps.description: Equipment datasheets, GA drawings, P&IDs, instrumentation, and control philosophy.

steps.title: Equipment Supply
steps.description: FRP tanks, PP vessels, rubber-lined tanks, piping — all fabricated in-house.

steps.title: Erection & Commissioning
steps.description: Site supervision, wet testing, biological seeding, and performance testing.

specs_table.description: Treatment technologies matched to application requirements.

case_study.description: Complete ZLD system for a dye intermediate manufacturer. 150 m³/day effluent treated to zero discharge with salt recovery.

cta.description: Share your effluent data and we'll design the treatment system.

hero.badge_text: ASME U & R Stamps · 80,000+ m² Facility
hero.lead: Pressure vessels, heat exchangers, reactors, columns, and storage tanks fabricated to ASME, API, and PED standards — on one of the largest integrated shop floors in the sector.

paragraphs: Jasmino's steel fabrication facility handles the complete cycle — cutting, rolling, forming, welding, machining, heat treatment, and testing — all under one roof.
With ASME U and R stamps, PED certification, and TÜV/BV approved procedures, we fabricate to international standards at competitive lead times.
Our facility: 60-tonne cranes, 4m rolling capacity, in-house stress relieving furnace, and radiography facilities.

pull_quote.text: The same company that designed your vessel fabricates it. The same company that fabricates it lines it. One roof.

evidence_strip.caption: Jasmino India · 80,000+ m² · ASME U & R Stamped

materials_section.title_html: What we build on the shop floor
materials_section.description: Heavy and medium fabrication across all major equipment types.

cards.title: Pressure Vessels
cards.subtitle: ASME VIII · Up to 350 bar
cards.description: Carbon steel, stainless, duplex, and exotic alloys. In-house PWHT and radiography.

cards.title: Heat Exchangers
cards.subtitle: TEMA · Fixed & Floating
cards.description: Fixed tubesheet, floating head, U-tube, and kettle reboilers. Helium leak tested.

cards.title: Storage Tanks
cards.subtitle: API 650 · Field Erected
cards.description: Shop-built and field-erected tanks to API 650. Jacking erection for large diameters.

cards.title: Pipe Spools & Structures

cards.description: Pipe spool fabrication from isometrics. Structural steel with hot-dip galvanising.

steps.description: Plate, forgings, and fittings procured to approved MTCs. PMI on all alloy materials.

steps.title: Cutting, Rolling & Forming
steps.description: CNC plasma/oxy-fuel cutting, plate rolling up to 4m diameter, head forming.

steps.title: Fit-Up & Welding
steps.description: SAW, GMAW, GTAW, SMAW per approved WPS/PQR. Qualified welders per ASME IX.

steps.title: NDE & Heat Treatment
steps.description: RT, UT, MT, PT, hardness. In-house PWHT furnace. ASNT Level II/III certified.

steps.title: Hydrostatic Testing
steps.description: Pressure testing per code. Test packs witnessed by TPI.

steps.title: Surface Prep & Lining Handover
steps.description: Equipment requiring lining blast-cleaned and handed to corrosion protection — same facility.

case_study.description: 12 vessels in SS316L, all rubber-lined in-house. Design, fabrication, and lining under one contract.

cta.description: Share your datasheets and we'll provide a manufacturing proposal.

pages.page_title: Plastic & FRP Equipment — Jasmino Equipment Manufacturing

hero.lead: Corrosion-resistant equipment in fibre-reinforced plastic, polypropylene, PVDF, HDPE, and PVC — for environments where metal won't survive.

paragraphs: For highly aggressive environments — plastic and FRP offers superior corrosion resistance at a fraction of exotic alloy weight.
We manufacture FRP vessels, tanks, ducts, scrubbers, and piping to BS 4994 and ASME RTP-1.
Because we also line steel equipment, we recommend the right material — FRP, lined steel, or plastic — based on your conditions.

pull_quote.text: We don't default to one material. We recommend the right solution based on your process conditions.

materials_section.description: Each polymer system offers specific advantages.

cards.title: Fibre-Reinforced Plastic
cards.subtitle: Vinyl Ester · Polyester · Epoxy
cards.description: Hand layup, filament winding. Vinyl ester and polyester resin with E/C/ECR glass.

cards.title: Polypropylene
cards.subtitle: Welded · Thermoformed
cards.description: Hot-gas and extrusion welded PP tanks, vessels, and piping for acid environments.

cards.title: PVDF
cards.subtitle: High-Purity · Ultra-Clean
cards.description: PVDF piping and vessels for semiconductor, pharmaceutical, and high-purity applications.

cards.title: Dual Laminate
cards.subtitle: Thermoplastic + FRP Structural
cards.description: Thermoplastic liner backed with FRP structural shell. Chemical resistance plus strength.

steps.title: Design & Laminate Schedule
steps.description: Structural design per BS 4994 or ASME RTP-1.

steps.title: Mould Preparation
steps.description: Release agent and corrosion barrier layup (C-veil + vinyl ester).

steps.title: Structural Layup / Winding
steps.description: Hand layup or filament winding. Resin content controlled.

steps.title: Cure & Post-Cure
steps.description: Ambient cure then elevated temp post-cure. Barcol verified.

steps.title: Testing & Inspection
steps.description: Hydrostatic, spark test, Barcol, acetone sensitivity, visual per BS 4994.

case_study.description: Complete FRP scrubber and ducting. Vinyl ester with C-glass barrier. 15-year design life.

cta.description: Share your chemical environment and we'll recommend the right material.

hero.badge_text: PFA · PTFE · PVDF · PP · PE · Rotolining
hero.lead: Fluoropolymer and thermoplastic barriers for extreme environments — where rubber can't go. PFA, PTFE, PVDF, PP, and PE by rotolining, loose lining, and welded sheet.

paragraphs: Plastic linings protect where rubber can't — concentrated acids, solvents, fluorine compounds, and ultra-high temperatures. Fluoropolymers handle virtually the entire chemical spectrum up to 260°C.
We offer: rotolining (seamless PFA/ETFE), loose-lined PTFE, and welded thermoplastic sheet (PP, PE, PVDF).
Applied to equipment we've designed and fabricated in-house — vessel geometry optimised for liner installation.

pull_quote.text: Rotolining creates a seamless, stress-free fluoropolymer barrier — no welds, no joints, no weak points.

evidence_strip.caption: HAW Linings · Germany · PFA Rotolining Facility

materials_section.title_html: Six systems for the full chemical spectrum
materials_section.description: Each system serves specific equipment types and environments.

cards.title: PFA Rotolining
cards.subtitle: Seamless · Up to 260°C
cards.description: Seamless fluoropolymer by rotational moulding. One continuous barrier — handles virtually all chemicals.

cards.title: PTFE Loose Lining
cards.subtitle: Sheet · Mechanically Anchored
cards.description: PTFE sheet fastened to steel. For large vessels and columns where rotolining isn't practical.

cards.title: PP/PE Welded Sheet
cards.subtitle: Hot-Gas & Extrusion Welded
cards.description: Cost-effective for mineral acid environments where fluoropolymers aren't required.

cards.title: ECTFE/ETFE Lining
cards.subtitle: Spray Applied · Rotomoulded
cards.description: ECTFE (Halar) and ETFE for combined chemical and temperature resistance.

steps.title: Substrate Preparation
steps.description: Blast clean, edges removed, spatter ground. Surface profile verified.

steps.title: Primer / Adhesive
steps.description: System-specific primer. For rotolining, vessel pre-heated and powder charged.

steps.title: Lining Application
steps.description: Rotomoulding, sheet welding, or spray depending on system.

steps.title: Weld / Seam Testing
steps.description: All welds spark tested. Pressure test on critical joints.

steps.title: Final Inspection
steps.description: 100% holiday detection, thickness verification, documentation package.

specs_table.description: Resistance comparison across plastic lining systems.

case_study.description: Seamless PFA for HF acid reactors. HAW Germany. 20-year service life target.

cta.description: Share your chemical environment and we'll recommend the right system.

pages.page_title: Coatings & Resin Systems — Jasmino Corrosion Protection

hero.lead: Spray, brush, and trowel-applied protective coatings for tanks, floors, bunds, and secondary containment — from vinyl ester flake linings to high-build epoxy systems.

intro.title_html: The coating is only as good as the application
paragraphs: Coatings and resin systems protect where sheet linings aren't practical — large field-erected tanks, concrete bunds, floors, trenches, and secondary containment.
We apply vinyl ester, epoxy, polyurethane, and ceramic coatings by spray, brush, and trowel. Each selected for the chemical, temperature, and substrate.
Our teams work on-site with NACE-certified inspectors supervising every stage — from surface prep through final DFT verification.

pull_quote.text: Surface preparation is 80% of coating performance. We never compromise on prep — and we inspect every square metre.

evidence_strip.caption: Coating Application · Chemical Tank Farm · India

materials_section.description: Four coating families covering steel, concrete, and composite substrates.

cards.title: Vinyl Ester Systems
cards.subtitle: Flake Lining · Trowel Applied
cards.description: Glass flake-reinforced vinyl ester for chemical tank interiors and concrete bunds.

cards.title: Epoxy Systems
cards.subtitle: Novolac · High-Build · Primer
cards.description: Novolac for chemical resistance, high-build for immersion, primers for multi-coat systems.

cards.title: Polyurethane Systems
cards.subtitle: Topcoat · Flexible · UV Stable
cards.description: PU topcoats for UV resistance. Flexible PU for expansion joints and vibrating equipment.

cards.title: Ceramic & Speciality
cards.subtitle: Abrasion · High Temperature
cards.description: Ceramic-filled for erosion in slurry systems. High-temperature for exhaust and flue gas.

steps.title: Surface Preparation
steps.description: Abrasive blast cleaning to Sa 2½ or Sa 3. Profile measurement. Dust and salt contamination testing.

steps.title: Environmental Monitoring
steps.description: Temperature, humidity, dew point monitoring throughout. Application halted if conditions outside spec.

steps.title: Coating Application
steps.description: System-specific application by spray, brush, or trowel. Stripe coats on edges and welds.

steps.title: Inter-Coat Inspection
steps.description: DFT, adhesion, and visual inspection between coats. Defects repaired before next coat.

steps.title: Final Inspection & Documentation
steps.description: Final DFT, holiday detection, adhesion pull-off, and complete documentation package.

specs_table.description: Recommended coating systems for common applications.

case_study.description: Vinyl ester flake lining for 8 storage tanks and complete bund coating at a chlor-alkali facility. On-site application with NACE Level III supervision.

cta.description: Share your application details and we'll recommend the right coating system.

hero.lead: Lining condition assessment, holiday detection, thickness measurement, and on-site repair — extending the service life of rubber, plastic, and coating systems across operating plants.

paragraphs: Even the best lining systems require periodic inspection and eventual repair. Planned maintenance extends service life by decades — unplanned failure causes plant shutdowns costing millions.
Our inspection teams assess rubber linings, plastic linings, and coating systems using holiday detection, thickness measurement, hardness testing, and visual assessment.
When repair is needed, we deploy the same application teams who installed the original lining. Same procedures, same materials, same quality — whether the equipment is in our shop or at your plant.

pull_quote.text: A scheduled inspection costs a fraction of an unplanned failure. We help you plan maintenance before the lining tells you it's too late.

evidence_strip.caption: Lining Inspection · Holiday Detection · Operating Plant

materials_section.title_html: Inspection and repair across all lining types
materials_section.description: Four service categories covering the full lifecycle of corrosion protection systems.

cards.title: Holiday Detection
cards.subtitle: Spark Test · Low & High Voltage
cards.description: 100% surface scanning for pinholes, pores, and discontinuities. Low-voltage wet sponge and high-voltage spark methods.

cards.title: Condition Assessment
cards.subtitle: Thickness · Hardness · Adhesion
cards.description: Non-destructive thickness measurement, Shore A hardness, adhesion pull-off testing. Detailed condition report with recommendations.

cards.title: On-Site Repair
cards.subtitle: Patch · Weld · Re-Coat
cards.description: Rubber patch vulcanisation, plastic weld repair, coating touch-up — on-site at your plant during planned shutdowns.

cards.title: Emergency Response
cards.subtitle: 24/7 · Global · All Lining Types
cards.description: Emergency repair teams for unplanned failures. Temporary and permanent repair solutions to minimise downtime.

process_timeline.description: A structured inspection and repair workflow.

steps.title: Scope & Access Planning
steps.description: Review equipment history, define inspection scope, coordinate plant access and safety requirements.

steps.title: Visual Assessment
steps.description: Systematic visual inspection documenting blisters, cracks, delamination, wear, and mechanical damage.

steps.title: Non-Destructive Testing
steps.description: Holiday detection, thickness measurement, hardness testing, and adhesion assessment.

steps.title: Condition Report
steps.description: Detailed report with findings, photos, condition ratings, and repair/replacement recommendations with timeline.

steps.title: Repair Execution
steps.description: Scheduled repairs during planned shutdown. Same materials and procedures as original installation.

specs_table.description: Applicable inspection and test methods for each lining system.

case_study.description: 5-year inspection and maintenance contract for FGD absorber rubber lining at a 600MW power plant. Planned patch repairs during annual shutdowns extended lining life by 8+ years.

cta.description: Schedule an inspection or request emergency repair support.

hero.lead: Engineered rubber compounds developed in our R&D laboratory — from natural rubber to advanced fluoroelastomers. 2,000+ proven formulations across four decades of compounding expertise.

paragraphs: Jasmino's compounding laboratory develops custom rubber formulations engineered to specific performance requirements — chemical resistance, temperature range, abrasion resistance, hardness, and compression set.
Our library of 2,000+ proven formulations spans the full elastomer spectrum: natural rubber, butyl, EPDM, neoprene, nitrile, CSM (Hypalon), silicone, and fluoroelastomers (FKM/Viton).

Every compound is tested in our in-house laboratory before production — tensile, elongation, hardness, ageing, and chemical immersion testing to verify performance against your specific service conditions.

pull_quote.text: We don't sell off-the-shelf compounds. We develop formulations for your specific chemical, temperature, and mechanical requirements.

evidence_strip.caption: Jasmino R&D Lab · Compound Testing · India

materials_section.description: Each elastomer family offers distinct advantages for specific environments.

cards.title: Natural Rubber
cards.subtitle: Abrasion · Resilience · Tear
cards.description: Highest abrasion resistance and resilience. Ideal for mining, mineral processing, and mechanical applications.

cards.title: Butyl & Chlorobutyl
cards.subtitle: Chemical · Gas Impermeability
cards.description: Outstanding resistance to mineral acids and gas permeation. The primary elastomer for chemical lining applications.

cards.title: EPDM
cards.subtitle: Ozone · Weather · Steam
cards.description: Excellent ozone, weathering, and steam resistance. Used for outdoor exposure, hot water, and polar chemical service.

cards.title: Fluoroelastomers
cards.subtitle: Universal Chemical · High Temp
cards.description: Near-universal chemical resistance at temperatures up to 250°C. For the most demanding sealing and protection applications.

process_timeline.description: Structured compound development with laboratory validation.

steps.title: Requirement Analysis
steps.description: Chemical environment, temperature range, mechanical requirements, and regulatory needs defined.

steps.title: Formulation Selection
steps.description: Elastomer type, filler system, cure system, and protective agents selected from our 2,000+ formulation library.

steps.title: Laboratory Compounding
steps.description: Lab-scale batches mixed and test specimens prepared for physical and chemical testing.

steps.title: Testing & Validation
steps.description: Tensile, elongation, hardness, ageing, and chemical immersion testing against specification requirements.

steps.title: Production Scale-Up
steps.description: Validated formulation scaled to production batch size. Process parameters documented for consistency.

specs_table.description: Chemical and physical property comparison across elastomer families.

case_study.description: Application-specific butyl compound developed for FGD absorber lining. 1,000-hour immersion test in simulated flue gas condensate. 15-year field performance validated.

cta.description: Share your service conditions and we'll develop the right formulation.

hero.lead: Custom moulded, extruded, and fabricated rubber products — from expansion joints and gaskets to wear-resistant liners and vibration mounts. Engineered for your specific application.

paragraphs: Jasmino's rubber products division manufactures custom moulded, extruded, and fabricated rubber components for industrial applications — using compounds developed in our own R&D laboratory.

From expansion joints and gaskets to wear-resistant liners, vibration mounts, and conveyor components — every product is engineered for the specific application using the right compound from our 2,000+ formulation library.
Because we compound our own rubber, we control the entire value chain — from raw polymer to finished product. No dependence on third-party compound suppliers.

pull_quote.text: We compound the rubber, we mould the product, we test the result. The entire chain under one roof.

materials_section.description: Four product categories covering industrial rubber component needs.

cards.title: Expansion Joints
cards.subtitle: Fabric · Rubber · Metal Insert
cards.description: Single arch, multi-arch, and filled-arch expansion joints for piping, ducts, and FGD systems. Custom flanged connections.

cards.title: Gaskets & Seals
cards.subtitle: Die-Cut · Moulded · Extruded
cards.description: Flange gaskets, manhole seals, door gaskets, and custom sealing solutions. Full-face, ring, and profiled designs.

cards.title: Wear & Abrasion Liners
cards.subtitle: Mining · Mineral Processing
cards.description: Chute liners, mill liners, screen decks, and pipe liners for mining and mineral processing. Natural rubber for maximum abrasion life.

cards.title: Vibration & Structural
cards.subtitle: Mounts · Bearings · Pads
cards.description: Vibration isolation mounts, bridge bearings, rail pads, and structural rubber components. Engineered for load and frequency.

process_timeline.description: Complete in-house manufacturing with compound control.

steps.title: Application Engineering
steps.description: Understand the application — loads, chemicals, temperatures, movement, and life requirement. Select compound family.

steps.title: Product Design
steps.description: Dimensional design, compound specification, tooling design. FEA for structural products.

steps.title: Tooling & Mould Manufacture
steps.description: In-house mould and die manufacture. CNC machined moulds for precision parts.

steps.title: Compounding & Production
steps.description: Compound mixed per validated formulation. Moulding, extrusion, or fabrication per production SOP.

steps.title: Testing & Dispatch
steps.description: Dimensional check, hardness, physical property verification. Every batch tested before dispatch.

specs_table.description: Product types and applicable manufacturing methods.

case_study.description: Custom butyl expansion joints for FGD ductwork at a 600MW coal-fired power plant. 3m diameter, designed for SO₂-laden flue gas at 180°C. 10-year service life target.

cta.description: Share your application requirements and we'll design the right product.
